availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Hough Cord (Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney. Mississippi native. Son of W.H. Cord. Married to Virginia R. Dupuy Cord on May 31, 1849 in Mason County, Kentucky. Father of William H. Cord, Irene Cord, and Mary Cord. Married to Mary F. Dupuy Cord on November 23, 1861 in Campbell County, Kentucky. Attorney in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Fleming County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 260A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 611.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film #000281843, p. 513.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Campbell County Marriages, Film #000465411, p. 43.
Find A Grave, "William Hough Cord (May 9, 1921-Mar. 7, 1886)," Memorial #, http://www.55841881 findagrave.com/memorial/55841881 (accessed March 26, 2020).
